characters: IN THE OTHER SIDE OF THE WINGS
FREEZE FRAME ON THE DIAMOND DEAD GUITAR
AT THE OTHER SIDE OF THE PARKING LOT 69

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whiffs of fog drift across the darkness as the moon emerg from behind the clouds illuminating crumbling cement bloc and twisted steel overgrown by weeds. ARIA DE WINTER, dre as a goth girl, climbs over the cement blocks carrying a bouquet of roses. She is in her mid forties, her face is worn. The years have not been kind to her. She lays the r on the ground and steps back.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: I miss you guys. My life has been a fucked up mess without you. This whole thing isn't fair. ARIA sits down among the rubble, thinking to herself. Beh her an IMPOSING APPARITION pulls itself from the swirling fog. It glides silently over the debris growing more soli it advances. It silently glides up behind ARIA. When it raises its head, it is some kind of long dead alien monstrosity. It is DEATH.

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: I say, I say. Strange place for flowers. She doesn't bother to look up.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: I suppose.

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: I say, I wonder if you can help, ma'am. Direction-wise, that is. ARIA turns around but doesn't seem to be bothered by the APPARITION.

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: I say, I'm looking for souls. Four long-haired hippie types. Look like girls on the wrong end of the ugly stick.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: Stiffs. Dirtnappers. Corpus Delectia in the post humus sense. Dig the wax out yer ears, ma'am. I'm talkin' English, ain't I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: I'm a death, ma'am. Mortis Extermis, Esq. My card.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: A death?

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: That's what I said. My mouth is movin' so I must be talkin'. I say, ma'am, pay attention, ya may learn somethin'. Lots of people croak every day. Logistically-wise one death can't handle the load. Are you following me here?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Sort of.

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: The world needs more than one death.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: So, what are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: Balancing accounts. I have four souls unaccounted for. It's very unusual for souls to stay under for that long. They're like lumpy gravy. They usually float to the top before the meat goes bad.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Well they're down there somewhere. DEATH stares at the ground chagrined.

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: Well. Baste my butt and call me vittles. I do declare, that's more diggin' than a man oughta do in my condition. I give up... I need a break.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: You need a break?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who’s gonna give me a break, I ask in mock ignorance and a general air of foreboding?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: How 'bout me?

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: Why I do declare, I think I may laugh if it didn't jostle my coccyx so much.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Why not? Beats sittin' on my ass. I'm a real people person. I'm slightly immoral and I temper all discussions with a nihilistic anticipation of general disaster. DEATH leans against a tree and a DOZEN BIRDS fall off the branches and hit the ground dead.

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: It's an awesome responsibility.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: So's voting.

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: I say, I say. There's powers that go with the title.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: A perk! Cool.

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: Take this scythe. He hands her his scythe.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: What kind of powers?

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: Life and death. Forward, reverse.

dialogues.speaker: SCYTHE
dialogues.text: There's a switch on the side of the handle that reads:

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Rad!

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: Alright little Miss spooky pants, you have one year. Your allotment is one person a day. And on all Hallows Eve when the clock strikes the hour of the wolf - that’s midnight eastern standard time - if you haven’t met your quota by then you forfeit your own soul and all those you love will be erased from existence. DEATH begins to walk away.

dialogues.speaker: DEATH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Have fun. Don't kill anyone I wouldn't kill. Knock yourself out Mortality-wise, that is.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Hey! Where ya goin'?

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: I’m going to get laid. Thanks babe. (to himself) Nice girl, but a little on the creepy side. DEATH departs. The sky blackens with storm clouds. Lightn strikes EXPLODE around ARIA. She lowers the scythe to the ground and hits the reverse switch. A BLUE ARC OF ELECTRI EXPLODES from the scythe slashing to the ground. The grou trembles. The electricity swirls around ARIA and the year fall away leaving her decades younger and beautiful. The ground begins to crack, we HEAR muffled screams. Sudd a mummified arm erupts from the earth holding the Diamond Dead guitar by the neck.

dialogues.speaker: FREEZE FRAME ON THE DIAMOND DEAD GUITAR
dialogues.text: Title up: DIAMOND DEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An old Gothic theater. The marquee reads: "DR. DIABOLICUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATHIAS STARK a nervous and nerdy type in his twenties, i polishing a brass rail on the staircase. There is a pound on the door. MATHIAS opens the door and comes face to fac with TwO SHERIFFS.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF 1
dialogues.text: Mathias Stark?

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Yes? SHERIFF 1 hands him some official looking papers. MATHIAS accepts the papers, then swats at a moth with them.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF 1
dialogues.text: Pursuant to the order of the court, I am serving you with this foreclosure notice.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Hey, you’re making a mistake. I got one more day to get the money! Puzzled, SHERIFF 2 leafs through papers on his clipboard.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF 2
dialogues.text: (turns to his partner) I told ya October has thirty one days!

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF 1
dialogues.text: We'll be back.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: I don’t think so. I got this fantastic rock act Diamond Dead playing tomorrow night. (points at a Diamond Dead poster) I’1l have the money right after the show. They give him a doubtful look and leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lobby lights turn off, then the signs, and finally th marquee lights. A few blocks away FOG rolls in eerily lit with blue light Inside the fog, LIGHTNING FLASHES. The THICK FOG rolls pa the theatre as MATHIAS locks the front doors for the nigh

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Fog. Cool. MATHIAS stands in front of the theatre, turns around and looks up at the marquee proudly. He shoves his hands in t pockets of his leather jacket, steps backwards and smiles

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I still own a theater. Life rocks! The street is deserted and quiet. All we HEAR is the BUZZ the power lines and the neon in the marquee sign. Then somewhere in the fog MATHIAS hears the sound of souped-up engines. They become louder. MATHIAS stares into the fog he can't make out anything. High on a pole, a transformer EXPLODES sending an electri surge down the street. A street light EXPLODES and goes d and then another and another.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the hell? A winged wraith like SHAPE streaks past MATHIAS, almost knocking him over. It's unearthly feed-back SCREAM ECHOES down the street. MATHIAS turns around but sees nothing.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Holy shit!

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Mathias Stark? MATHIAS turns around. ARIA is standing in front of him wi sinister smile on her face. She wears a top hat with a ve and a black dress.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Yaah!

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Did I scare you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Jesus Christ.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Good. I'm Aria De Winter

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: You're with the band, right?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: No. They're with me.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Do you hear fourtwentynine engines with headers, fuel injectors and two inch straight pipes? Cuz I do.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: That's the road crew. FOUR CUSTOMIZED HEARSES appear out of the fog. The DRIVER are dressed in nineteenth century livery. They stop in fr of the theatre and wait, unmoving.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Awesome.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Isn't it...

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Your agent said you'd be here tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: It is tomorrow -- three past twelve.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I was just going home. A TALL GAUNT MAN steps from one of the hearses and walks to ARIA, his arms outstretched. He holds a scythe on a pu satin pillow.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Thank-you, Rasputin. I'll catch up later. She takes the scythe. The man bows slightly and walks awa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet you're a terribly fascinating little boy, Mathias. Kinda sexy in an innocent sort of white meat way. ARIA twirls the scythe like a baton.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Would it be alright if we went inside and started setting up?

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Sure. I'll open up for you.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Don't bother. We got it. The lobby lights TURN THEMSELVES ON, then the sign and th marquee.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Hey! How'd you do that?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Magic. We're in show business.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: C'mon. Let's you and me get a cup of coffee down the street and leave the boys to do the grunt work ARIA tucks her arm around MATHIAS and leads him down the street.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're kinda small, aren't ya? Kind of feminine features.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Well, I...

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Don't worry. I like girls, too.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: I think I'm in over my head.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Not yet, but if you're lucky, who knows?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help. ARIA and MATHIAS walk down the street. CAMERA pushes past Mathias and Aria into a window and we are in:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK and GEENA are in their living room. JACK is a young in his mid-twenties: Mohawk, shredded clothes, ridiculous features. GEENA is his roommate: young, beautiful with lo dark hair and mischievous eyes. They are sitting in front the TV looking catatonic, watching an infomercial as if o Thorazine.

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: Well, where do you wanna eat then?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I don't care. Where do you wanna eat? Long silence.

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: Let's just take a walk and we can figure it out later.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Okay. Neither of them stand up. They continue to stare at the T

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: C'mon.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I can't. The radiation from the TV has drained my will to resist its electronic seduction. I have no will of my own. Turn it off.

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: I can't. You turn it off.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Oh, God. We're doomed.

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: Victims of a technology we cannot control.  10. JACK reaches over the side of the couch and grabs a shoe.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: If I can... just.. reach.. my shoe. I can... Ugh! He throws the shoe. It hits the off button on the TV.

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: Thank God.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: That was close. We gotta find that remote.

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: No shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A seedy run down dive. The neon sign EXPLODES leaving onl few glowing letters. The sign now reads “JACK OFF SHOP”.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATHIAS and ARIA are having coffee.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: You look nervous.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: I'm not nervous. I always look this way in case something weird happens.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Have you ever seen a Diamond Dead show before?

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: No. But I heard a song or two... okay, that's a lie, I never heard of you guys until your agent called last week. Don't hate me.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: So you're saying the only reason we're booked is because we called first.  11.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: I inherited the theatre from my uncle. You have a band. I have a place to play. Next week I got Devo unplugged and Crosby Stills Nash and Johnny Rotton. That's gonna suck. But hey, I'm just staring out.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: That's fair.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: How long have you guys been together?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Forever. Awhile, couple weeks decades, eons, a couple epochs. Thank the Mother it's almost the apocalypse. I hate time.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Do you have any music I can listen to?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: That's not important. What is important is that you listen to me.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Um... Okay.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Do you scare easily?

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Yes. Like right now when you asked, do you scare easily I think I just pissed a testicle. I'm kind of high strung.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: I'm just saying that spooky shit may happen. But don't worry. It'll all work out.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Don't worry? Saying, "Don't worry," to someone like me is like a cop saying, "Bend over, this is a cavity search." What's to worry about, Aria?  12. MATHIAS (cont 'd) Are you a band of Satanic killers or something? Because if you are I want it on the record that I am not a virgin.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: You seem like a nice guy. It's just that we attract a weird crowd. Things don't always follow a natural pattern with us.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Sounds like my sex life.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Really.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: No, but I like to fantasize. ARIA playfully slides her heel up Mathias’ leg digging in a second. Mathias is nervous and aroused.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Ready to go back to the theatre? MATHIAS looks embarrassed and uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Um no. I'm just going to sit here for a few minutes. If that's cool with you?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Suit yourself. ARIA exits. MATHIAS squirms in his seat, grabs some ice c and drops them down his pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK and GEENA walk down the street carrying some junk fo Suddenly JACK stops in front of a telephone pole.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Hey Geena, check it out.

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: What? On the pole is a POSTER for the Diamond Dead.  13.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Diamond Dead are coming. They are so mythic, they’re so underground, they’re a rumor. And the scum of the earth is goin’ to come out to see them.

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: Looks like a dirt head metal poser band to me. I thought you hated Heavy Metal.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Dr. D isn't Heavy Metal. They're a... they're a hard-core grunge wave rockabillie band. Yeah, a kinda techno dance neuromantic retro glam hip hop be bop slamarama mosh squash. Goth meets David Lee Roth. C'mon, you know.

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: They look like a Metal band.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Yeah, well... they are, but they're good. Can we go? Huh? Can we? Huh? Please, Geena? Please?

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: Your white trash is showing, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: It is? I'm sorry. We gotta go, Geena. It’s going to be rock history. No-one has ever seen them do a show. Please. Please.

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: Fine. We can go.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Let's get in line for tickets! We need sleeping bags and shit. You go get the supplies and I'll save you a spot.  14. She rolls her eyes. They see FOUR HEARSES in front of the Grand Quignol.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Where do you suppose someone can get a hearse at this time of night?

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: Kinda strange, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Good strange, or bad strange?

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: All strangeness is good. It helps break up the monotony. A GAUNT FIGURE steps out of the darkness. It is DEATH.

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: I say, I say. Hello, kiddies. JACK and GEENA start.

dialogues.speaker: JACK AND GEENA
dialogues.text: Yaah! Fuck!

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: Up past your bedtime?

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: You dick!

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: I was kinda hoping I could get your autograph. DEATH produces a long contract from out of nowhere. It unrolls into the street for about ten feet and then stops releasing a tiny terrified RAT LIKE CREATURE that was tra inside. It scurries away into the darkness squeaking in terror.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: Yeah. What for?

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: A trade.  15.

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: What kind of trade?

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: I give you backstage passes and I get your immortal soul.

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: Damn! Jack and I already sold our souls to Madonna for a couple T- shirts and a case of beer. Across the street the ROADIES are carrying FOUR COFFINS i the theatre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARIA is walking to the theater on the dark street and not DEATH with the kids. She strides up to them.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: (to Jack and Geena) Hi guys, not to be rude or anything, but I gotta talk to Morty here. Hope you don’t mind. She gives them two backstage passes. The Marquee suddenly SPARKS UP, showering the street and DEATH ARIA are gone.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Whoa!

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: Shiiit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEATH leans against a dumpster. ARIA, scythe drawn, is re for a fight.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: Why, I’ve done given ya power over life and death. Now, we have a bargain. You were supposed to deliver souls by the deadline. I ain’t seen ya whakin’ nobody.  10 14 16. DEATH(cont 'd) You don’t deliver Missy, and I’m gonna have to do ya and your friends. And that includes that little freak I seen ya cattin’ around.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: I have til midnight. I’1l take care of it.

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: Well, I’m gonna have to hang around and make sure you do.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Fine. Go nuts. Just don’t get in may way.

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: You won’t even know I’m around... DEATH steps backwards and merges with the wall and disappears. ARIA is left to think about Death’s implied threat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATHIAS walks to the theatre. The street is completely covered in Diamond Dead posters. A huge billboard adverti the "Holy Church of Good Intentions" is replaced with the band's logo. A BUM sleeping in a doorway has a poster glu to his back. MATHIAS rounds the corner and finds the front of his thea mobbed with ROCK AND ROLL FANS, PROTESTERS, TV TRUCKS, POLICE, AND T-SHIRT VENDORS.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Is this hell? He pushes his way to the front doors, fighting off REPORT and SCREAMING DIAMOND DEAD FANS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUSSY A. DANGLE, the oh-so-hip VJ from NTV (Nerve Televis and her CAMERAMAN are in front of the crowd.  17.

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY
dialogues.text: This is Pussy A. Dangle, live from The Grand Quignol Theatre, somewhere in the cultural hell we call the Midwest. The excitement builds for the legendary rock band that everybody worships but have never seen, The Diamond Dead. MATHIAS enters, stunned by the mess in front of his theat The camera light flashes in his eyes and he is blinded.

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm talking live with Mathias Stark, owner of this wonderful new pop oasis and host to America's latest contender for the Shock Rock crown, Dr. Diabolicus and the Diamond Dead. Tell me Mathias, what are Dr. Diabolicus and the Diamond Dead really like? Are the rumors really true? Are you in fact sleeping with Aria De Winter, the band’s rhythm guitarist?

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: What?! !

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY
dialogues.text: Do the Diamond Dead really practice satanic rituals before every concert?

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: I did not sleep with Ms. De Winters!!! I just met her. We talked. I hardly know her.

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY
dialogues.text: Is it true that members of the band have felony warrants in Romania? Any comment? MATHIAS stares at the camera, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: um...I need coffee. MATHIAS runs up the stairs to his office and slams the do  18.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A quaint place, but not without charm. Ramshackle antique furnishings, a sofa-bed on the side, a desk facing the do The stage illuminated by the work light can be seen throu window. MATHIAS bursts in and finds ARIA sitting on his desk provocatively.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Hello, lover.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: (startled) Don't you start. Oh my God. It's a nightmare out there. Reporters cops, crazed fans.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: That's the biz. MATHIAS’ eyes travel down her body to her fabulous legs.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Look, Aria. You're a sweetheart and I would sleep with you in a hot second. I'm a simple neurotic manic depressive. I slept with two women in my life. It was a disaster both times. I don't do well under sexual pressure. So if you must, let's get it over with so your disappointment won't be too humiliating. He closes his eyes and grits his teeth.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? MATHIAS collapses on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Oh, God. I dunno. I'm crazed. I'm sick. I freaked out. I need coffee, goddamit!

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: I'll get it.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Thank-you! And God bless you!  13 19. ARIA goes to the coffee maker.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: You can't let this stuff get to you. Do me a favor, just go with it. Pretend it's all a dream.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: That's hard. If this was a dream, I'd be better-looking and you'd be naked.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, it's still early.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: You're great. She hands him the coffee.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: I know. If it's any consolation, the place is sold out. So you just relax. I'll handle the crowd and the media circus.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Thanks. ARIA exits. MATHIAS, feeling impending disaster spills hi coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUSSY is interviewing the CROWD.

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY
dialogues.text: Look at me, America. I have it on good authority that the members of this band are in fact dead. A HEARSE screeches around the corner and the FANS start screaming. A particularly CRAZED FAN runs into the middle the street.

dialogues.speaker: FAN 1
dialogues.text: Diamond Dead! Diamond Dead! I wanna be just like you guys!! The hearse runs him over.  20.

dialogues.speaker: FAN 2
dialogues.text: Ugh! PUSSY stands over the road-kill kid.

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY
dialogues.text: Diamond Dead. Teen idols or the Avatars of Death. Who the hell do these guys think they are? Let's ask the fans. PUSSY grabs a particularly stupid-looking METALHEAD BURNO

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So. What do you...

dialogues.speaker: METALHEAD
dialogues.text: Diamond Dead! Diamond Dead! Diamond Dead!

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY
dialogues.text: Um...Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: METALHEAD
dialogues.text: Diamond Dead!

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY
dialogues.text: Pardon me.

dialogues.speaker: METALHEAD
