dialogues.text: Yes, I love God. What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND
dialogues.text: The end times are here Mr. President. The 69th sign. Verse 4, chapter 9. The dead have risen from the grave. Satan’s handmaidens have arrived and they call themselves the Diamond Dead. As the Lord is my witness, Armageddon will be upon us if they are not stopped. You are aware of the biblical consequences if their show goes on?

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT
dialogues.text: I'm very aware of the biblical ramifications Jimmy. I’1l get one of my boys to deal with this right away. Jimmy? Sounds like you're in pain? Is that Mistress Veronica I hear in the background? Tell her Air Force One is standing by. I'll see her at Camp David. The PRESIDENT enters the helicopter and it takes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARIA walks up to PUSSY. On stage, the performance continu

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: So, what do you think?  31 32 33 41.

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY
dialogues.text: I don't see how this is possible. They're dead. They reek formaldehyde. How can it be?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Part magic, part science, mostly bullshit. It's all so fabulously decadent, isn't it? Oooh, you don't want to miss this. This is where Dr. D spits maggots at the audience.

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY
dialogues.text: Oh, please, Jesus! She starts to puke again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. D sprays the AUDIENCE consisting of the press, sound crew, hangers on, etc. with a ridiculous excess of slime maggots. Song “Necrophilia” ends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARIA looks down to PUSSY passed out on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Wimp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GEENA and JACK sitting in the front row are drenched in maggots and slime. JACK plucks a maggot from his face.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Look, Geena, real live maggots.

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: Are you sure? That looks like a meal worm to me.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Nope. That's a maggot.

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: I don't think so.  34 35 36 42.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: It restores my faith in American advertising. Real live maggots. Cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. D smiles sheepishly at the now-soaked AUDIENCE.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Miss anyone?

dialogues.speaker: AUDIENCE
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: FAVOR MATHIAS
dialogues.text: He is standing at the back of the theatre, covered in sli

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: (to himself with anguished sarcasm) This is the best day of my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flying high in the skies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PRESIDENT is talking to the CIA Director, LARRY SIMMS

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT
dialogues.text: Goddamit Simms, you're the CIA Director for Chrissakes! If the dead are rising from the grave, I want to know about it.

dialogues.speaker: SIMMS
dialogues.text: Yes Mr. President.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT
dialogues.text: This has significant military implications. We must have dead raising capability. We must know the secret to life and death. I want you send your best operative to get it for me.

dialogues.speaker: SIMMS
dialogues.text: Yes sir. I know just the right person for the job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fabulous old Gothic structure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vaulted ceilings, stain glass windows. The beautiful marb altar is made ugly by a giant black velvet portrait of th Reverend Scruggs. A television sits on a pedestal, showing Dr. D spewing maggots. Suddenly, the TV is smashed by a twenty pound sledgehammer. REVEREND SCRUGGS throws the sledgehammer to side, and returns to the pulpit

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND
dialogues.text: Brothers and sisters, that was the scene at the Grand Quignol Theatre. Truly the end times are upon us. For the Bible says, "The Devil walks among us." And, yea, though I walk through the valley of the shadow of Death, I shalt take no shit. Cue: “Gospel Funk Track” which continues until end of sce

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND
dialogues.text: The Devil has come, brothers and sisters, and he's one big sneaky son of a bitch. The dead walk the earth. Frankly, dear sinners, I feel a completely reactionary, knee- jerk, ignorant, fanatical outburst of violence is necessary to trod the serpent underfoot! Praise the Lord?

dialogues.speaker: FLOCK
dialogues.text: Praise the Lord.

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND
dialogues.text: It is written that the meek shall inherit the Earth but who wants this dirtball if it's crawling with rotting cadavers? Not me!

dialogues.speaker: FLOCK
dialogues.text: Amen!

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND
dialogues.text: Oh, no! Not me!

dialogues.speaker: FLOCK
dialogues.text: Amen!

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND
dialogues.text: We must stamp out this evil. We must crush this festering blemish on the Earth between our two fingers of justice and watch as the yellow pus of evil squirts high and splats oozing down the mirror of pure crystal goodness.

dialogues.speaker: FLOCK
dialogues.text: Ooooh, Yuck!

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND
dialogues.text: I feel the right swift hand of vengeance moving in me. I am his terrible swift sword. We must cut off the left hand of darkness to spite our faces. The Diamond Dead are messengers of death. We are soldiers of life. Let us cause violent death so that we may be rewarded for our life-affirming murder. We shall rebury the buried once and re-kill the already dead.

dialogues.speaker: FLOCK
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND
dialogues.text: Praise the Lord.

dialogues.speaker: FLOCK
dialogues.text: Praise the Lord!

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND
dialogues.text: Hallelujah!

dialogues.speaker: FLOCK
dialogues.text: Hallelujah!

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND
dialogues.text: "Vengeance is mine, sayeth the Lord," but mindless slaughter is for everybody, sayeth I. Amen!  39 45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATHIAS gets up from his hands and knees on the stage, ha finished cleaning up the mess. He is wearing a rubber apr safety yellow cleaning gloves and has an air-filter mask his face. He moves the mask onto the top of his head when ARIA enters.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: You wanted to see me.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: I'm not sure.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: The sound check was great. We're going to make a killing. The band loves this place. I think we could book a week here, easy.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Because I'm gonna kill myself as soon as I'm aware enough to feel it. He starts walking toward his office, she walks next to hi

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Maggots, dead men, slime all over my theatre, haunted hearses reporters everywhere, femme fatale rock women, too much coffee, not enough sleep, mucus covered clothes, caffeine sugar shock, Thorazine, too much weirdness cerebral hemorrhage, sexual frustration, genuine terror, large mounds of...

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Stop already. You're babbling.  46.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Am I?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: I know we're a lot to take all at once. It's the way we are. Excess is best. Shock appeal and all that P. T. Barnum kind of stuff.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: It worked. I'm shocked.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. It's all in fun, honest. It's rock and roll. They enter his office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATHIAS flops on the sofa-bed. ARIA faces him.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: (blurts it out) So, do you love this Diabolicus dude?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Doesn't matter. He doesn't love me, so fuck it. SONG: "CRASH-TEST DUMMIES IN LOVE": ARIA AND MATHIAS play background.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Good?

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Well... um... I'm not above exploiting a broken heart for my own personal gain.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Look at me. I have to take advantage wherever I can. Just watch... I respect you, Aria.  41 42 43 47. MATHIAS(cont 'd) I think that any guy who would snob you is an asshole and a Cyclopean jerk. You are incredible.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Hey, that's pretty good. What do you do next?

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: I don't know. I've never got it right before. I don't have a clue. ARIA leans forward and kisses him.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: How 'bout that?

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Wow. This thing seems to have its own momentum. They kiss again. Song ends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establish.

dialogues.speaker: DOOR
dialogues.text: A sign reads: "CIA SUPER-SECRET HUSH-HUSH BLACK ROOM."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chairs are filled with TEN MEN IN GRAY SUITS looking SIMMS, who presides at the head of the table.

dialogues.speaker: SIMMS
dialogues.text: This is not a simple situation. We can't handle it with S.0.B. These guys have gone high profile.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 1
dialogues.text: Yes sir.

dialogues.speaker: SIMMS
dialogues.text: We have no choice. We’ve got to call in our best paranormal and aberrant sexual operative.  48. One of the MALE AGENTS jumps up on the table. He stands u straight, covers his face with his hands and lifts up on tiptoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two stiletto heels click into place like switchblade knives(music beat one, two) and the shoes transform into women’s pumps. Black plastic skin tight armor replaces hi male attire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A riding crop springs into his hands. A mechanized corset grabs and constricts his waist. His chest swells under plastic bra cups (music beat three, four). Now only his f remains male. He lowers his head, hair obscuring his face Then throws her head back and it is VERONICA VINYL.

dialogues.speaker: SIMMS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Agent Mistress Veronica Vinyl.

dialogues.speaker: ALL THE AGENTS
dialogues.text: Oooooh!

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA
dialogues.text: (to one of the agents) Oh, stop drooling. You'll get spit on my pumps. (to Simms) I read the file. VERONICA launches into a production number.

dialogues.speaker: SIMMS
dialogues.text: Yes, Agent V... I mean, Agent Mistress Veronica Vinyl.

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA
dialogues.text: Make sure there's a jet helicopter waiting to take me directly to the theatre. Production number ends.

dialogues.speaker: SIMMS
dialogues.text: I actually feel sorry for those boys.  44 45 49.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large time worn room. Exposed duct work, stained yellow walls with holes in the dry wall. The BAND is sitting aro playing poker.

dialogues.speaker: BANGZ
dialogues.text: Fucking road. Fucking gig. Fucking road. Fucking sucks.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: You've got a busted hand, don't you, sweetie.

dialogues.speaker: BANGZ
dialogues.text: Fucking cards. You and your fucking poker face.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: It's called rigor mortis.

dialogues.speaker: BANGZ
dialogues.text: I fucking fold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARIA and MATHIAS are making out, Mathias breaks away gasp for breath. ARIA looks at the clock on the wall. Time is precious to her.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: See? No disasters, no weirdness...

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: I know, weird, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: You're impossible. ARIA pushes MATHIAS back onto the desk and begins strippi him.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: I mean, usually when I start to have a good time, the universe retaliates a lot quicker Technically, I shouldn't be able to get my shoes off before I get whacked.  50.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Maybe your luck is changing.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Or maybe the universe is setting me up for a big one.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Look Mathias baby, could we have less talking and more groping, I don’t have much time.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: I like to talk Aria. I need to talk. Can’t we do both?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Okay, what ever. How did you get in the theatre business?

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: I used to write music reviews until I flipped out. One night I found myself drunk and dancing on the roof of Alice Cooper's tour bus naked, singing "Born Free" with a Filipino transvestite named Dwight. ARIA pulls down Mathias’ pants and sees the impressive bu

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Whoa!

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: I quit the magazine next day and moved here. Tell me about your band.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Fine... What do you want to know?

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: I wonder what it would be like to be dead. ARIA pushes MATHIAS back on the bed and jumps on top of h

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Something Like this!  46 51.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BAND sit around a table playing cards. There is a kno at the door. RASPUTIN sticks his head in.

dialogues.speaker: RASPUTIN
dialogues.text: Dinner is served. D sweeps the cards off the table. A line of BEAUTIFUL SER GIRLS enter carrying covered trays of food. They set the on the table and remove the covers. Beneath is piles of r meat and other unsavory things. The BAND attack the food with growls and tearing of flesh The exception is GLITTER, who takes the time use a knife fork and the best table manners.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: What was it like for you, D? Dying, I mean? You know, the first time... not including bad gigs.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: I don’t know. It was kinda spiritual.

dialogues.speaker: BANGZ
dialogues.text: The fucking afterlife bites.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: Mine sucked, too. As they talk food flies everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: I remember the white light and so I went in.

dialogues.speaker: BANGZ
dialogues.text: Fucking hurt my eyes.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: I saw that too. Note: the scenes described by the band during the followi Green Room scenes will be shot in the style of 1950’s sci movies.  47 48 52.

dialogues.speaker: HEAVEN BACK DOOR 47
dialogues.text: A dirty alleyway with dumpsters full of garbage. A couple ANGELS with wings, wearing hair-nets sneak a smoke break share a bottle in a brown paper bag. BANGZ walks up to th door. Over the door is a sign: "HEAVEN BACK ENTRANCE EMPLOYEES ONLY." BANGZ sighs deeply.

dialogues.speaker: BANGZ, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Fuck, man. I didn't go in. This fuckin' prick wearing a fuckin' sheet stopped me and fuckin' said, "You can't fuckin' go that way. Musicians have to use the fuckin' back door." INT. MATHIAS’ OFFICE - NIGHT 48 MATHIAS and ARIA are in bed, getting it on. A ROADIE knoc on the door.

dialogues.speaker: ROADIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Aria, the fire inspectors are here. ARIA and MATHIAS stop moving under the blankets.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: ROADIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: They say we can’t use the magnesium flash grenades in the show. They say it will cause blindness and the smoke is neuro-toxic.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Fine. Use the riot smoke cannisters. And point the industrial laser at the audience. Same effect and the side effects aren’t as bad. The ROADIE leaves and ARIA resumes. MATHIAS stops her.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: I can’t do my best work if we’re going to interrupted all the time. I need a moment to get my breath. Tell me more about the band. Why does Spyder wear a mask?  53.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: (frustrated) Nobody knows except Bangz and he’s not talking.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Bangz used to be the sweetest guy until he saw what Spyder looked liked under the mask. He just cracked.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Now Bangz just curses and swears and hates everything. Whatever he saw must have been bad.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: What about Spyder?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Spyder’s all right. He only talks through his puppets. A touch of evil, but on the whole a nice guy. He works out his problems with his puppets. A man who wears sock puppets can’t be that dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Mostly sure. Now can we get back to business, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dinner continues. Meat and blood and food is everywhe and on everyone.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: I remember falling.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: Falling and falling.  50 51 54.

dialogues.speaker: OUTER SPACE 50
dialogues.text: SPYDER is falling through the eternal darkness towards th light. He shoots past it, hurtling into outer space.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: .. But I missed. Shot right past it. I went hurtling into outer space.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: What happened? SPYDER'S BODY flies uncontrolled towards a GIANT MAGGOT l creature lined with huge sphere-like eyes.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: There's something out there. It lives beyond the light. It's not the Devil, it’s worse. It looks like all the evil in the whole universe. Black and bloated, all festering and cancerous. The thing’s nictated eyes open, releasing a swirling blac tempest of radiation that envelopes SPYDER'S body as he SCREAMS in agony.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I guess the thing ate whatever souls missed the light. I could feel the stuff changing me. Warping me... I couldn't stop it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BANGZ has become so engrossed by Spyder’s story, he hasn’ noticed he’s gnawing on D’s arm.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: (to Bangz) Do you mind? (to Spyder) That why you wear a mask?

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: Small price to pay for your eternal soul. I got called back so I guess it paid off.  55.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: Sorry, Spyder.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: What about Diabolicus?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: I don't want to talk about him.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Glitter, then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dinner continues.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: Heaven was so beautiful: all fluffy clouds and stars. It looked just like my senior prom.

dialogues.speaker: HEAVEN 54
dialogues.text: ANGELS are lounging around on clouds. GLITTER, in his rob and wings and rhinestone halo, stands on his cloud and le loose with a harp solo, singing at the top of his lungs. ANGELS stare at him.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: (singing) bees And as we wind on down the road! Our shadows taller than our souls. There walks a lady we all know, Who shines white light ....and ....wants to bees SHOW... ee eevee He stops singing.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What?! It’s Stairway to Heaven. Led Zepplin... what?... fine... (to himself) And she’s buying a stairway t...

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Shhhhh!  56.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: (whispering) beens to heaven 55 INT. MATHIAS’ OFFICE - NIGHT 55 MATHIAS and ARIA in bed.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Glitter’s a real sweetheart, but a real screamer in the gender department. It's a shame, too, because he's beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Ugh! They're mummies.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: I know, but my dad was a mortician. After a while, that kind of warps ya. I know everybody doesn't share my taste but fuck ‘em. I think they're unique.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: I guess that's true. Personally disturbing, but true. Tell me about Diabolicus?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: I don’t want to talk about him. Don’t you ever shut up? ARIA waves her hand and the lights go out. Under the blan the going gets heavy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dinner continues.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: You saw Jesus?

dialogues.speaker: BANGZ
dialogues.text: Whoa!

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: What was He like?

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: He was cool.  57.

dialogues.speaker: HEAVEN 57
dialogues.text: DIABOLICUS in his leathers and Black Sabbath T-shirt is walking in heaven. He walks toward a FIGURE in the distan It is JESUS. Glowing halo, golden vestments and sacred he medallion on his chest. Dr. D stops a passing ANGEL.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Ganja ? The ANGEL ignores him pointedly. Dr. D continues. He approaches JESUS, who looks androgynous and holy, arms outstretched amongst the clouds.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Hey Jesus dude, I'm a big fan.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: Thanks... I like you too man. I like all you rock and roll guys. Hey listen you got any rolling papers?

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Sure. You got any smoke?

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: Don't tell Dad.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: It's cool.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: You smoked a bowl with the Son of God? That rocks!

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: What did you talk about?

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: All sorts of shit. He said straights and 9-5-ers didn’t need Him much and that a lot of Bible- humpers were posers. One thing He said was kinda cool.  59 60 61 58.

dialogues.speaker: HEAVEN 59
dialogues.text: JESUS and Dr. D are getting toasted. They are lying ona cloud, staring up at the stars, passing the joint.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: He said He likes hanging with the fuck-ups. People who fuck up are the people who need Him most and learn the most.

dialogues.speaker: BANGZ, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Fuckin' A.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Hey dude, don't bogart the joint.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: BANGZ
dialogues.text: Fuckin' cool.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: I guess we're supposed to fuck up. If you do everything right, you don't score any points.

dialogues.speaker: BANGZ
dialogues.text: I guess I'm a fucking genius then.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: And I'm Mother Theresa. RASPUTIN enters and places a large cake on the table.

dialogues.speaker: RASPUTIN
dialogues.text: Dessert. I call this Zombie surprise. RASPUTIN cuts into the cake and cockroaches erupt from th inside, scurrying all over the table. The boys stab at th greedily with their forks. INT. MATHIAS’ OFFICE - NIGHT 61 MATHIAS and ARIA in bed.
It's a damn shame they died, though. Still, now that they are dead, I like them more.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: You sure are odd, Aria.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Thank-you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 62 The BAND lie around the room bloated and happy. D belches loudly.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Being dead was hard.

dialogues.speaker: BANGZ
dialogues.text: Yeah, fuckin' big boobed bummer.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: I don’t want to go through that again alone.

dialogues.speaker: BANGZ
dialogues.text: Next time we fuckin' croak, we fuckin' croak together.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: . And we fuckin' stick together all the way.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: All for one!

dialogues.speaker: BANGZ
dialogues.text: Yeah. All for one... and for one! Fuckin' A! Bangz farts.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: Well said, Bangz. 63 INT. MATHIAS’ OFFICE - NIGHT ARIA and MATHIAS are smoking in bed. for the yellow cleaning gloves. . All 63 MATHIAS is naked except  60.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: You’re leaving something out. I can smell a big ole butt a mile away....Let me rephrase that.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Well... We had one other problem to overcome.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: The Diamond Dead are cannibals.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Don't worry. We got it mostly licked now.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: What do you mean, mostly licked?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: We had a few minor incidents.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Such as?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: We think Spyder ate my landlord.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Oh-my-God!

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Spyder won't talk about it. He was completely freaked out. That's when he started using the sock puppets.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Oh my God... How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: I found some bones in the laundry room... Just a couple... And a left shoe. Oh yeah. A pacemaker. That's all!

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: That's horrible.  64 61.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: My landlord was an asshole.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Still, I mean... I don't know what I mean.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: We solved that problem, though.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Raw beef soaked in synthetic human pheromones. Smells like shit.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Does it work?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: If they eat regular.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: And if they don't?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: I make sure they do. It's not their fault that they're flesh-eating zombies. It's a handicap.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCRUGGS and his NUMBER ONE ZEALOT get off THREE BUSES. Th are followed by a SMALL ARMY of fanatics. They start marc along the street, handing out pamphlets along the way.

dialogues.speaker: ZEALOT
dialogues.text: Our ETA's one hour.

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND
dialogues.text: Fine. We shall hunt down the undead and burn them in their own den.

dialogues.speaker: ZEALOT
dialogues.text: I don't think that would be wise.

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND
dialogues.text: Why? The Lord is with us.  62.

dialogues.speaker: ZEALOT
dialogues.text: A thousand rabid Diamond Dead fans might object to us immolating their heroes right in front of them.

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND
dialogues.text: "The Lord is my shepherd." He will protect us.

dialogues.speaker: ZEALOT
dialogues.text: The good book also says, "Thy rod and thy staff shall comfort thee."

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND
dialogues.text: Truly, brother. what do you suggest?

dialogues.speaker: ZEALOT
dialogues.text: Let's buy some rods.

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND
dialogues.text: Hmmm.

dialogues.speaker: ZEALOT
dialogues.text: Billy Bob's 24 Hour Christian Gun Shop is two blocks from the Grand Quignol Theatre. Billy Bob has served our church's assault weapon needs for twenty years.

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND
dialogues.text: Thou art truly a man of God, brother.

dialogues.speaker: ZEALOT
dialogues.text: Thank-you Reverend, I try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VERONICA VINYL presses a hidden button her riding crop an antenna rises out of the handle.

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA
dialogues.text: (speaking into the crop) Agent Vinyl reporting in. Get me Simms. (beat) I saw Reverend Scruggs' and his mindless sheep at the bus terminal. They are on their way to the theater and they ain't toting Bibles.  63. VERONICA(cont 'd) I got a backstage pass and I don't want loony tune Elmer Gantrys screwing up my show... Are you wearing the pink panties I sent you?... Slut! She hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I love my job.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE OTHER SIDE OF THE WINGS
dialogues.text: DR. D, SPYDER and GLITTER sit, watching the ROADIES work.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: I got a bad feeling about tonight.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: I don't think we're experiencing anything that other superstar bands haven't gone through in the past.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: You've got to be kidding?

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: I live in a constant state of dread. I like it.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: I don't know, man. Something isn't right. I'll agree with that.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: It's you, D. That's what's not right here.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: You're in love. You stupid dead- neck son of a bitch! You're too damn self absorbed to see it!

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: (both puppets singing) D and Aria, sitting in a tree K-I-S-S-I-N-G. Dr. D pulls both of Spyder's puppets off his hands and th them over his shoulder.  64.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: Aaaah! SPYDER looks at Dr. D with venom in his eyes and runs aft them.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: I've got problems, dude.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: You got no problems. You're over that now. She loves you. How many girls do you know who are willing to accept you in your particular state?

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: This is necrophilia you're talking.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: What's your point?

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: It makes me sick to think of her touching something like me. I respect her. I want to keep it that way.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: She doesn't have a problem with you.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: I have a problem with me. I'ma thing, a ghost, a memory. She's in love with a memory.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: Some memories. Our lives sucked. Maybe this is all the afterlife we get. This is our just reward. Maybe, this time it can be better. We've got one more shot.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARIA and MATHIAS are dressed.  67 65.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: You gotta have a little faith sometime Mathias. Have a little faith in me.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Okay. You're right.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: You're right.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Say it one more time.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: I said you are right. Why are you making me say that?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: I've never heard a man say that before. That's amazing.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Well you're right Aria. I gotta trust someone. I gotta unclench my sphincter sometime. ARIA kisses MATHIAS sweetly.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: You are so-o hot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK and GEENA corner DR. D and fire off rapid fire quest not allowing D to respond.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: So, is that your real hair, or just a wig?

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Uh...

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: How do you pronounce your vowels without lips?  66.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: If you're dead, how come all your blood doesn't settle in your ankles?

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: Have you thought that as your brain decomposes and turns to methane gas that the smallest spark could blow your skull apart?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: With no circulation, how do you get an erection?

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: How come your eyeballs didn't shrivel up?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: How do dead people shit? Dr. D looks around for some sort of escape from JACK and GEENA. He spots VERONICA VINYL seductively stalking acros the backstage area.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Sorry, guys. The old Doc just found the cure for what ails him. Dr. D beelines toward VERONICA.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hello. Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA
dialogues.text: I don't know. Do you have a high pain tolerance?

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Dead nerve Diabolicus is what they call me. What do they call you besides maybe gorgeous?

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA
dialogues.text: Veronica Vinyl, but you can call me goddess.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: I don't know. I'm an atheist.

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA
dialogues.text: I can cure that.  67.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Are you for real?

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA
dialogues.text: Are you?

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Let's not ruin a perfectly depraved conversation with existential paradox disguised as philosophy.

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA
dialogues.text: I agree. Intellectual banter impedes one's ability to maintain a sensual sense of spontaneity, and in fact hampers positive primal instinct.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: It's all such a semantic nightmare of pretense, don't you think?

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA
dialogues.text: So do you wanna screw?

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Yup.

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Hearse?

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA
dialogues.text: Perfect.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Let's go. Dr. D and VERONICA exit. SPYDER steps out of the nearby shadows .

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: Ummmmm. I'm gonna tell.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: Don't be a snitch.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: Doctor Diabolicus is being bad.  68 68.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: He's working shit out. Leave him alone.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: I can't. I'm a creature of strict moral code.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: You're a sock.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: That doesn't mean I can't aspire to be the best sock I can.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: You're messed up.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: Hey, if we tell Aria, we might get a dramatic, if not violent response from the whole thing.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: Guaranteed.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: Let's do it. SPYDER skips across the backstage area, singing.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: Aria! You'll never guess what we saw!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEREND SCRUGGS and THE FLOCK are standing in the parkin lot.

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND
dialogues.text: Brothers and sisters, we stand before God, humbled this night. For we know we do his work, thus saving us direct consultation. And yea though we carry no sword of justice, we can carry the AK 47 of righteousness.  69 70 69. At JIMMY'S feet are two cases of machine guns.

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Line up, brothers and sisters, and receive thy communion. The REVEREND grabs the first rifle and slams in a clip.

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: God bless America!

dialogues.speaker: AT THE OTHER SIDE OF THE PARKING LOT 69
dialogues.text: One of Diamond Dead’s hearses is bouncing violently up an down. Over the squeaking of the suspension, Diabolicus ca HEARD screaming.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Oh my God! Oh my God! Stop! Stop! My spine! Ouch! I can't do that! Ouch! Ouch! Stop! Mister wiggle worm is very fragile. You'll twist it off! Oh please stop!

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yes! Yes! Show me the secret of life and death! It makes me sooo hot.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Oh please stop!

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Is that all ya got dead boy? One more time!

dialogues.speaker: DR. D, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Noooooo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We HEAR Aria's voice screaming inside the dressing room.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I can't believe it! That slimy road kill son of a bitch! The dressing room door explodes outwards and SPYDER flies through the air. He lands on his back. ARIA steps over hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna kill him, then I'm going to reanimate him, and then I'm gonna kill him again. ARIA exits through the backstage door.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: Spectacular results.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: Next time you wanna play with a grenade, let's not sit on it after we pull the pin.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: Point taken. MATHIAS steps through the ruined dressing room door and addresses SPYDER.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Umm... Don't you guys have to be on stage in a few minutes?

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: Didn't you read our contract? It states that in case of accidental re-death among the band, the show can be delayed up to one hour.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: How long do you suppose this delay may be?

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: Depends on whether we get D back in one piece or several. I hate when they fight. The results can be quite disturbing. All the screaming and crunching bones...

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Don't tell me anything else. Tell Aria. I'll see her later. MATHIAS exits, shaking his head sadly. 70.  71

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. D and VERONICA step out of the smoking interior of th hearse. VERONICA appears immaculate. Dr. D, however, look like hell, disheveled, pale and sweaty.

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA
dialogues.text: Thank-you, D. That was truly a revolting experience.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: We aim to disgust.

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA
dialogues.text: I'll call you.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Give me a couple weeks. Okay? VERONICA walks off.

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA
dialogues.text: (to herself) That was a waste of pelvic pressure. Shit! ARIA approaches Dr.D.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Why, Aria... Um... Hi. I was just thinking about you. ARIA swings and hits Dr. D in the face. His head SPINS AR UNTIL IT FACES BACKWARDS.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: You unbelievable prick

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: I deserved that. Do you feel better? ARIA stomps on his foot.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yaah! AS DR. D tries awkwardly to bend forward with his head on backwards, ARIA kicks him in the ass. DR. D flies forward his head smashes through the windshield.  72 72.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Curtain in thirty minutes. Dr. D lies there, stunned. His voice is muffled inside th hearse.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Anything you say, Aria.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Damn straight! ARIA stomps off.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: It's interesting to me how I can be such an amazing asshole knowing that the universe won't let me get away with jack shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEREND SCRUGGS stands in front of the theater, leading PROTESTERS. The sticks on their signs bear a close resemblance to gun stalks. JACK, who in the meantime has drifted outside the theater, is pulled from of the crowd the REVEREND.

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND
dialogues.text: Have you found the Lord?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What does he look like, dude? Is he inside?

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND
dialogues.text: He is the Lord of all things. The Father of creation. He is Alpha and Omega.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Hey, if I see him, I'll tell him you're out here. What is he wearing?

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND
dialogues.text: I'm concerned for your immortal soul, son. The Lord loves you and He wouldn't want you to go inside.  73 74 73.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Shit. This guy must know my parents, because they're wound awful tight, too.

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND
dialogues.text: (shoves him back into the crowd) Never mind.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Rock and roll!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATHIAS and ARIA are together.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: I just have this hideous feeling that something hideous is going to hideously happen to me...

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Don't be silly. Life is hideous. Rock and roll just fills in the gaps between the monotony of day to day futility.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Well. If you put it that way... The walkie-talkie in her hand buzzes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RASPUTIN is on the walkie-talkie. INTERCUT with ARIA as desired.

dialogues.speaker: RASPUTIN
dialogues.text: No shit, Aria. There's about sixty born-again fanatic right-wing types out front. They look really pissed off... Yeah. It's that crazy Rev from TV. It gets worse. On top of that, the American Guild of Funeral Directors are planning to picket. They say the band is restraint of trade. It's kind of scary out here. The roadies want to break out the real guns... We got to protect our audience.  75 76 74. ARIA seems delighted to hear this.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: (into walkie-talkie) Open the doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RASPUTIN is at the door as FANS stream past after being frisked by SECURITY. Huge piles of CONTRABAND and WEAPONS heap up on either side of the doors: everything from drug rocket launchers.

dialogues.speaker: RASPUTIN
dialogues.text: Alright. Protesters on the left, ticket holders on the right. No drugs, booze, food, beverages nudity, or politicians. No fighting, running, pushing, jumping or excessive breathing. No sex, sex guides, sex lubricants or sex deviance. No studs, spikes, car keys, pagers, cell phones or laptop computers. Most important, no guns grenades, rocket launchers, anti- personnel mines or catapults, cross- bows, swords or siege equipment. Keep moving. Enjoy the show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VERONICA is watching the ROADIES work. SPYDER pops his puppets out from around the corner. The rest of his body hidden.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: Hey, shark lady.

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: We want to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA
dialogues.text: I don't talk to footwear.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: I don't usually talk to women who dress like a plastic action figure, but it's a new experience.  75.

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA
dialogues.text: (moving closer) What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: Ummmmm. . .

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: We want sex. It's a character flaw we have.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: D had sex, so we want sex, too.

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA
dialogues.text: I'm not a vending machine.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: How was it with D?

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA
dialogues.text: You're one sick sock.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: We sure are. So how was it?

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA
dialogues.text: Interesting.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: How would you like to graduate to unique?

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA
dialogues.text: Do you know the secret of how to reanimate the dead?

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA
dialogues.text: Will you tell me?

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: Are you kidding? For a little play I’d rat out my own mother. The puppets retreat behind the corner. VERONICA follows. HEAR footsteps. CAMERA rounds the corner and angles on th slightly ajar dressing room door. Voices come from the ro

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What's with the mask?  77 76.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Would you like to see?

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Whatever.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Are you sure? It's not pretty.

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Nothing about this gig is pretty. Show me already.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Okay. You asked for it.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: (together) Ta-da! Veronica SCREAMS and the door SLAMS shut

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARIA is talking to RASPUTIN behind the amplifiers. In the background the crowd is chanting.

dialogues.speaker: CROWD
dialogues.text: Diamond Dead! Diamond Dead!

dialogues.speaker: RASPUTIN
dialogues.text: I don't know, Aria. This is a dangerous situation. The police are trying to close us down. The fanatics are screaming at the door. God knows what those crazy pricks are up to. I'm scared.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Five minutes.

dialogues.speaker: RASPUTIN
dialogues.text: The boys could get hurt.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Five minutes. Make the call.

dialogues.speaker: RASPUTIN
dialogues.text: Alright. It's your circus.  77.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK and GEENA have found seats on top of the marshal amplifiers.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Boy, these seats kick ass.

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: Does it look like a riot from up here or what?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Yeah. The band hasn't even come on yet.

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: Gee. It looks kinda dangerous down there.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: ...And we're above it all.

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: Nice and safe. No moshing or fighting or fucking or pushing.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: These seats suck!

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: Yeah. Let's go bug the band.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Fuckin' A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house is going wild as the AUDIENCE works itself up i a fever pitch. Acts of individual lunacy add to the chaos

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The THE BAND is doing their touch-ups, except for SPYDER, is unaccounted for. JACK and GEENA enter and walk over to ARIA who has Dr.D on a table and is stuffing his open sto cavity with silicon.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What ya doing?  78.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: To prevent decomposition I had to remove the boys internal organs and replace them with silicon.

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: Cool.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: I feel like a giant tit.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: You are, dear. Dr.D and ARIA are purposely ignoring each other.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: D, why don’t you talk with Aria?

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: No thanks.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: Aria, you talk to D. He loves you.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Bullshit. JACK and GEENA are still curious.

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: What’s Bangz doing over there? BANGZ is bathing in a big barrel and is wearing a shower

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: That’s embalmers lotion. Helps keep their skin to be pliable. Unfortunately embalmers lotion is mostly a powerful synthetic female hormone. BANGZ stands up in the barrel and is sporting a fabulous of female breasts.

dialogues.speaker: BANGZ
dialogues.text: Oh! I cant fucking live with this at all!

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Oh shush. Look at Glitter! He isn’t complaining.  79. GLITTER dances around the room flaunting his new tits.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: I feel pretty, oh sooo pretty.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Can I try that stuff... I mean as a experiment ? Umm... Never mind. D gets up from the table and suddenly looks concerned. He looks down his pants in horror. Bangz steps closer and lo down D’s pants curiously.

dialogues.speaker: BANGZ
dialogues.text: Fuck me D. Where’s your man monkey?

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Oh God! I hope I left it in the hearse ‘cuz the alternative is to horrible to contemplate.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: What I want to know Aria is, so what if D slept with another woman...

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Yeah. So what?

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: I mean, c'mon sweetie, everybody knows you boinked that neurotic theatre manager.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ! Is nothing sacred?

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: You slut!

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: You prick!

dialogues.speaker: BANGZ
dialogues.text: (to Glitter) You're a fuckin' diplomatic genius baby.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: Sorry.  80. SPYDER enters. Everyone falls silent. All eyes turn on hi accusingly. There's a long pause.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: Where the hell have you been, girl?

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: Aww, you know, here and there.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: It's thirty seconds to curtain. What were you thinking?

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: Baseball, petroleum products, how much I really enjoy a good meal.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: You got blood on your mask.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: It's paint. It's nothing.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: Who'd you eat, Spyder?

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: That's blood, dude. Who'd you eat?

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: I didn't eat anybody. Honest.

dialogues.speaker: BANGZ
dialogues.text: I saw that fuckin' rubber bitch and Spyder go into a dressing room earlier. I think they fuckin' did more than fuckin' fuck. RASPUTIN enters.

dialogues.speaker: RASPUTIN
dialogues.text: Curtain.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Oh my God... I can't believe you ate Veronica.  81 81.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: I thought you said she didn't matter to you.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: She doesn't. I mean, she does. I mean, she was eaten, for Chrissakes. That matters.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Not if she didn't mean anything to you. You shouldn't care.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: How would you like it if I ate your spazola boyfriend ten minutes after you shtupped him?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Don't you touch him. He's a nice guy.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: See. Bugs ya, don't it?

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: I didn't eat anybody!!!

dialogues.speaker: RASPUTIN
dialogues.text: Curtain!

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: C'mon. Let's rock and roll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ANNOUNCER walks up to the microphone. The AUDIENCE fr out. The lights come up on the stage. The set is a forced perspective of a overgrown necropolis on the outskirts of bombed out Emerald City of Oz. A LARGE CLOCK on a marble is part of the set. Suddenly, there's a BLINDING FLASH and ARIA appears stand on a tomb with guitar in hand. She strikes an open chord the graves begin to split. Rising out of the earth, the r of the BAND appears. ARIA begins to speak, weaving a kind Rock and Roll spell which sets events in motion.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: (singing) Mirror mirror in hells own heart Who’s the baddest band to blow part! Mirror mirror staring in my face! Who’s the baddest bitches to rock this place.

dialogues.speaker: DR.D
dialogues.text: (singing) Stomp on the gas! Lets go! Move your ass! Lets blow! Hit the highway ! Don’t Stop! All The way over the top!

dialogues.speaker: CHORUS
dialogues.text: (singing) My little piece of Armageddon. It’s a suicide pact. An unholy weddin’!

dialogues.speaker: DR.D
dialogues.text: (singing) Foot off the brake! Kick it out! Let your hands shake! Scream and shout! Turn off the headlights! Pistons Cry! Feel your fright! Brain fry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUSSY sings into the CAMERA. REVEREND SCRUGGS stands near

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY
dialogues.text: (singing) Tell me how’s my hair! Check my face. Let’s shoot this thing! I know my place.

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND
dialogues.text: (singing) I’m gonna Pray to God, lock and load. It’s a holy march. A bloody road.

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY AND SCRUGGS
dialogues.text: (sing chorus) My little piece of Armageddon. A righteous cause. A fitting endin’!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATHIAS watches the show. ARIA sings on stage. The music tempo slows. THE LIGHTING CHANGES AND ARIA AND MATHIAS AR THE ONLY TWO PEOPLE IN THE THEATRE. ARIA is illuminated i single follow-spot.  84 85 83.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS ARIA
dialogues.text: I can't believe I'm still (sings an aria over here. She's a musician. She's Mathias speaking) not my type. What happens Don’t let your dreams die. when she gets tired of me? I'm afraid. I'm afraid of everything. I don't feel good. (singing) ) Its my little piece of Armageddon. My hell, my soul bloodletting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The spot light irises out revealing the stage. THE LIGHTS COME UP AND WE ARE BACK IN THE SHOW. The BAND is playing the stage. Dr. D approaches the microphone.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: (speaking) Do you believe in life after death? The CROWD SCREAMS. Dr. D looks over at ARIA who returns h stare.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Neither do we! The beat picks up and the chords change.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: (singing) Burn witch burn. Back To hell! There is no future! What’s that smell!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The REVEREND and his FLOCK have drawn their weapons.

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND
dialogues.text: (speaking) Let's go kick some pinko commie satanic demon ass!

dialogues.speaker: RASPUTIN
dialogues.text: Try to hold them back.. Shit! They rush the doors and overpower the SECURITY GUARDS.  86 87 84.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ZEALOT carefully places a large TIMED EXPLOSIVE PACKAGE the air-conditioning system. He checks his watch and pres a button on the timer. The clock on the explosives starts ticking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BAND is playing in the background.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: (singing) Feed the god. We want sacrifice. Born for sin raised on vice! It’s my little piece of Armageddon A suicide pact an unholy weddin’. REVEREND SCRUGGS and his FOLLOWERS rush into the theatre, shooting wildly. They charge down the main aisle toward t stage.

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND
dialogues.text: Stop this secular humanistic debauchery! The REVEREND fires a round, hitting GLITTER'S guitar. The BAND stops playing. The music continues as a_kind of tens underscore. They look at one another, confused, and then SCRUGGS. An eerie stillness falls over the confused CROWD

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: That bitch shot my Les Paul!

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND
dialogues.text: And the Lord said unto me: Drive the unclean spirit from thy land!

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: You bitch! That's a Les Paul! Girl, don't you have any respect?

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Duck! ARIA, DR. D, SPYDER and BANGZ dive for cover.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: Fuck that. I'm gonna slap dis Ho'!  85.

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND
dialogues.text: Fine! The FLOCK opens fire on the stage. The music builds in te with gunfire as percussion, pumping hundreds of rounds in GLITTER, tearing away huge chunks. The gunfire continues until the FLOCK has emptied their clips. What's left of GLITTER crumbles to the ground. The FLOCK frantically reloads. RASPUTIN charges onto the stage, followed by TEN ARMED ROADIES. Music returns to a tense underscore.

dialogues.speaker: RASPUTIN
dialogues.text: Freeze! The REVEREND turns to his flock

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND
dialogues.text: We shall be rewarded in Heaven. The ENTIRE AUDIENCE suddenly JUMPS UP WITH GUNS DRAWN pointing at SCRUGGS.

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We have exorcised the unclean spirit. SPYDER, Dr. D and BANGZ stand up, armed with machine guns walk to the apron.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: (into microphone) Does anybody here not have a gun? In the balcony, MATHIAS raises his hand.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Um... I don't.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Sir, would you please be kind enough to leave the building? MATHIAS runs for the exit. Dr. D fixes SCRUGGS with a venomous stare. ARIA steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: My turn.  86.

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND
dialogues.text: Burn in Hell, Satan! She waves her arm and the lights suddenly go out. The mus becomes the sharp percussion again. The entire theatre ER in gunfire. It creates a kind of STROBE LIGHT effect as hundreds of guns fire at once. The gun battle goes on for full twenty seconds before the shooting finally ceases an the lights come back up. Everyone in the auditorium lies dead. The music changes to a slow eerie dirge like tune. rolls into the house. In its center DEATH glides in. The CLOCK on the marble tomb begins to chime midnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEATH stands in the middle of the house, knee deep in bod

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: Now, I say, I say. That's entertainment. ARIA steps onto stage, carrying the scythe. She steps ove PUSSY'S BODY and over to Dr. D's still form, lying face d

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Are you dead?

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Yes. She kicks him in the ribs.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Good. You stupid son of a bitch! Look at this place. Holy shit. It's a fucking mess. I can't have this kind of shit every night.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Sorry. I'll get a mop. DEATH begins climbing over the bodies toward the stage.

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: I say, this positively elegant. You found a novel way to balance the books. I knew you were a natural. Excuse me lady, but I really do need my scythe back.  87.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: I need it right now. I can't leave things like this. Dr. D, BANGZ and SPYDER get up and go to GLITTER'S RUINED CARCASS.

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: You're gonna have to. Give me my scythe. Dr. D walks over to ARIA's side.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Who is this guy, Aria?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Nobody.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Then fuck him. The bell continues to toll very slowly.

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: Everybody goes. No exceptions. Your a Goddess of Death now.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Keep it, Aria.

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: We had a bargain missy. It's time. ARIA walks to the edge of the stage and leans over, as th final bell tolls.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: I fulfilled my bargain Morty. She raises up her scythe, hits the reverse switch and twi it over her head. Lightning FLASHES in arcs from the stag points in the house and to the balcony. Lights EXPLODE. T breakers fail and the theatre is thrown into an eerie lig as the slain audience’s bodies begin to twitch and convul with new life.

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: Noooooooo00!  88.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: The clock struck twelve Morty. Our deal is done, and I’m off the clock, and you can’t do shit. DEATH rises up out of the pit and onto the stage charging ARIA in a rage. MATHIAS steps out of the wings between ARIA and DEATH.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Leave my girlfriend alone! You dick! DEATH swats MATHIAS out of the way and MATHIAS is airborn crashing into the amp stack. D, BANGZ and SPYDER attack D to little effect. He knocks them aside as easily as he di MATHIAS. ARIA swings the scythe with both arms and throws it at DE It spins through the air as if in slow motion. It shears DEATH’s head cleanly and buries itself in the proscenium arch. ARIA picks up Death’s head and throws it to BANGZ.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Lose this somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: BANGZ
dialogues.text: Fucking hard-core!

dialogues.speaker: DEATH'S HEAD
dialogues.text: Put me down! That's my think tank you're bowling with! The SLAIN rise, in harmonic choral parts. First the Sopra section spotted around the house then the tenors, bariton Then everybody.

dialogues.speaker: AUDIENCE
dialogues.text: (singing) Don’t let your dreams die! Don’t let your dreams die! SCRUGGS is standing in the pit, facing the audience. His FLOCK and ZEALOT are singing along with the audience.

dialogues.speaker: SCRUGGS
dialogues.text: What are you doing? You’re my faithful followers! What about the church? What about God? What about me?!  88 89. The AUDIENCE and FLOCK sing louder. SCRUGGS realizes he has lost everything and skulks toward the exit. SPYDER carries Glitter’s only remaining body part, which his HEAD, offstage. The AUDIENCE continues to sing. Dr. D walks up to the microphone.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen. Dead and back again, courtesy of the Diamond Dead! We love you! Good night! ARIA takes her guitar and throws it into the audience. It arcs high overhead, spinning slowly, disappearing into th darkness. Dr. D drives the blade of broadsword microphone into the stage and walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PEOPLE are leaving the theatre. PUSSY talks to her TV audience.

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY
dialogues.text: The Diamond Dead have made rock history tonight, demonstrating their powers over life and death. One thousand bullet-ridden Diamond Dead fans will tell you that it was real. What's next for this band? Who knows, but it doesn't matter because I was here and you weren't. JACK and GEENA walk out of the theatre. She is carrying Aria’s guitar and he, Dr.D’s microphone. They also sport bullet holes in their bodies.

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What do you think of the Diamond Dead?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Yeah. They were cool.

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: A little weak on bass and the energy seemed a little down.  90.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: The sound engineers seemed to favor the high end.

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: I noticed that, too.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: It's a common mistake.

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY
dialogues.text: But what about the climax?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: The whole death trip has been a little overplayed.

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: What are the Diamond Dead going to follow it up with?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: It's the whole Andy warhol trap.

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: They've got no place to go.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Sorry, Pussy, but the Diamond Dead have reached their height.

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: Has-been city.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Great while it lasted.

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: Pack it up Pussy. PUSSY stares open-mouthed as JACK and GEENA walk away. As they walk away GEENA starts playing ARIA’S guitar. JACK slings Dr. D’s microphone over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I got shot four times in the chest!

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: I got it in the head, and a shotgun in the belly.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: That was so fucking cool.  89 90 91.

dialogues.speaker: GEENA
dialogues.text: Where are they playing next?

dialogues.speaker: DRESSING ROOM DOOR
dialogues.text: From the room we HEAR voices.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: D?... D?... Are you there, pal?

dialogues.speaker: DR. D, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I'm right here, dude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARIA and the BAND are gathered around GLITTER’S HEAD on t table.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: Looks like it's our last gig together.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Bullshit!

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: (coughing) No, I'm outta here, girl. Listen to me.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: I want you to have my thigh high boots, the faux zebra platforms. You always coveted them.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Don't talk like that.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: Spyder? SPYDER begins to talk with the SOCK PUPPETS, but instead jerks them off his hands.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: I'm here.  91 92.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: You can have all my socks and my Ibenez Paul Stanley Special.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: Don't die again.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: Sorry, Bangz?

dialogues.speaker: BANGZ
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: BANGZ
dialogues.text: Fuck you too! Asshole.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: Aria?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: You got the ax. Don't let the band die.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Sure. GLITTER closes his eyes and goes still. Silently, Dr. D, BANGZ and SPYDER exit, leaving ARIA. ARIA lays a scarf ov GLITTER'S HEAD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCRUGGS, not quite given up, is creeping around in the da hallway with menace in his eyes. He rounds a corner and c face to face with D, SPYDER and BANGZ.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Can you pray, Rev?

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: Better make it a short prayer

dialogues.speaker: BANGZ
dialogues.text: Yeah. Real fuckin' short.  92

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Say "hi" to Jesus for me. SPYDER has is back to CAMERA. He removes his mask. SCRUGG eyes widen in horror. His unholy scream is cut short by a dark tongue-like object impaling his head.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARIA is alone with Glitter’s remains. There's a COUGH und the scarf and ARIA pulls it away.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: Where is everybody?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: We thought you were dead.

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: I ain't dead. I'm just a head.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: GLITTER
dialogues.text: (coughing) I think I got a slug stuck in my throat. Could you dig it out? MATHIAS enters.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: I need your help.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: I'm really not well.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: C'mon. I need your help. The boys have gone after Scruggs. They're gonna kill him. Where's your car keys?

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: I need your car. I think Scruggs is on his way to the airport.  93 94.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: You can't drive my car. It's a Stingray classic. I don't even drive it.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Perfect! ARIA grabs MATHIAS by the arm.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: I don't have time to argue. The boys are hungry and we got to stop them before it's too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is now deserted. Dr. D, BANGZ and SPYDER walk through the lobby, knee deep in garbage.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: I had fun.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Me, too.

dialogues.speaker: BANGZ
dialogues.text: Why, we got a hell of a fuckin' show. We kill the audience every night. Wow! I think it's fuckin' great.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Everybody's afraid of death. It's an unknown. People feel powerless against it. Some folks will see us as having the power to help them beat death. Others will see us and think if they can beat us, they can beat death. Either way, every show we play is going to be a slaughter.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: We did what we came to do. We fucked with everybody.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: We better go underground.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: We can't hide.  95.

dialogues.speaker: BANGZ
dialogues.text: What about Aria?

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: You love her right?

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: Ahhh! She doesn't need me. She needs that little guy. I finally figured it out. I don’t need a lover. I love me. I'm what I need to be happy. I’m just too damn cool. I'm to damn me. And nobody should have to deal too much with my me-ness.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: That is either the most noble thing you have ever said or the most disgusting. They exit through the lobby doors and walk up to the stag

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VERONICA VINYL is in front of the stage with Aria's scyth DR. D, BANGZ and SPYDER walk up to her.

dialogues.speaker: BANGZ
dialogues.text: Hey, it's the fuckin' rubber lady.

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA
dialogues.text: Hello, boys.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: Told you I didn't eat her.

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA
dialogues.text: Hello, Spyder honey.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: Where ya been? She leans against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: D, Bangz, this is Veronica, soon to be Mrs. Syn. VERONICA is a bit taken aback. She twirls the scythe.  94 95 96.

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA
dialogues.text: That’s mistress Veronica.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: Yes mistress Veronica.

dialogues.speaker: SPYDER SYN
dialogues.text: (to D and Bangz) What a woman.

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA
dialogues.text: I was sent here on a Presidential secret order. For this. (she holds up the scythe) It was my job. Not that I don't enjoy my work. I do, but you guys are different. If I let the government get hold if this, we’d all be fucked.

dialogues.speaker: DR. D
dialogues.text: That’s fine by me. Like the man says, better to burn out than to fade away. SPYDER removes the sock puppets from his hands and hugs VERONICA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Grand Quignol EXPLODES in a fire ball. Aria’s scythe flies through the air, disappearing into the night sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scythe falls from the sky embedding its blade in the blacktop of the road. A breeze blows dust past. On the wi is distant music. ARIA’S hand reaches down and pulls the scythe from the blacktop. ARIA and MATHIAS stand on the shoulder of the road, having just stepped out of Mathias' STINGRAY.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Sure you don't want to come with?

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: No. I'm committing myself ina couple hours.  96 97.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Suit yourself. What about your theatre? MATHIAS smiles sheepishly.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: I'm insured.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: I'm gonna miss you.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: I'll miss you too, in a strange masochistic, romantic, terrified way. I'm sorry about your band. I'm sorry about your... you know... um boyfriend.

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: I'm gonna miss a lot of things. Oh well, that's life.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: According to death?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: That's me. MATHIAS gets in the car.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: You're truly special. You know that, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: ARIA
dialogues.text: Of course. I'm not stupid. MATHIAS starts his car and drives off. EXT. MATHIAS’ CAR - MOMENTS LATER 96 MATHIAS is talking to himself.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: This sucks. A HEARSE going the other direction screams past MATHIAS.  97 98 98.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARIA begins to walk down the road, her scythe over her shoulder and a head-shaped bundle wrapped in butcher’s pa in her hand. A CAR speeds past her and then slams on it's brakes. It i '57 CADILLAC HEARSE. ARIA smiles and gets in. The HEARSE roars its engine and takes off for the vanishing point. EXT. MATHIAS’ CAR - MOMENTS LATER 98 MATHIAS slams on his brakes and power slides 180 degrees. roars after the hearse.

dialogues.speaker: MATHIAS
dialogues.text: Rock and Roll ! This is crazy! This is crazy!
